text:
Am I able to use the value of a field in fields.json and apply it to the parent element? For example, if I create a Choice field, can the choices be CSS classes, and can that choice then be added to the parent element? The use case is that I have a bunch of :hover animations I want to use, and I have them coded as CSS classes. I want to take what the user has selected for a button as the hover class and add that class to the button. Then I would run a macro to retrieve the relevant CSS for that class and apply it to the selected user input.
`button,`
`.button {`
 `{{ button_font.style }}`
`....etc`
`}`

`button:hover {`
  `{{ background-color: {{ button_hover_bg_color }};`
  `...etc`
`}`

`{{ hover_class }}:hover {`
  `hoverclass({{ theme.buttons.hover.hover_class }});`
`}`
